intro: Fumaria vaillantii subsp. schleicheri, commonly known as the Schleicher's celandine, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its bright yellow flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its botanical features include stipitate (stalked) leaves and a short, stout stem. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
